intro: Kiggelaria flavovelutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf kiggelaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Kiggelaria flavovelutina is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
